forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
In the loader, SETUPLDR.BIN there are 4 (four) charactrs "I386" for the name of the directory with the source, you CANNOT fit more in it, as you have learned with Flyakite's Tutorial, having a "flat" LiveXP (that uses normally "I386") needs only to make a directory in ROOT like "LVXP" or "LIVE" with the livexp conntents and edit the SETUPLDR.BIN in it (that you will chainload from grub4dos).  

You may also want to remove the need for "tag files" (or move them from root), see here:  
[http://www.msfn.org/...les-like-win51/](http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/65541-edit-txtsetupsif-so-you-dont-need-to-move-files-like-win51/ "External link")  

About Win 7/BOOTMGR, you may be interested in reading this seemingly unrelated thread:  
<http://reboot.pro/8043/>  

And also a "win 7 AIO" tutorial:  
[http://www.windowsva...-in-single-dvd/](http://www.windowsvalley.com/create-windows-7-aio-all-in-one-dvd-or-merge-all-editions-of-windows-7-in-single-dvd/ "External link")  
In the latter, BEWARE of quotes:  
[http://www.msfn.org/...reate-a-w7-aio/](http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/150146-issue-when-i-create-a-w7-aio/ "External link")  

> And what mkisofs.exe parameters should I use to build my dvd in order to work for as many systems ... ie I have long path characters, both upcase and downcase letters and which mode of dvd type?  
But are you using cdimage.exe (which you shouldn't/aren't allowed to ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) ) or mkisofs.exe? ![:whistling:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/happy22.gif)  

If mkisofs, you can try with the switches talked about here:  
<http://reboot.pro/9696/>  
[http://reboot.pro/96...mbedded__st__26](http://reboot.pro/9696/page__hl__embedded__st__26 "")
